Retrieve a Field from One or All Datasets in a Functional Area

Source: R/file-handling_int.R
dot-fh_dataset_field_get.Rd

This internal helper function extracts a specific field (e.g., "name", "transformation", "directory") from either:

  1. A specified dataset by name, or

  2. All datasets in a given functional area (if .dataset_name is NULL).

Usage

.fh_dataset_field_get(
  .functional_area,
  .dataset_name = NULL,
  .field,
  .config = .hl_config_get()
)

Arguments

.functional_area

A character string indicating the functional area (e.g., "master_data", "sales").

.dataset_name

An optional character string specifying which dataset's field you want (e.g., "material", "mat_sales"). If NULL, the field is retrieved from all datasets in the functional area.

.field

A character string indicating which field to retrieve (e.g., "name", "transformation", "directory").

.config

A list or environment containing the loaded configuration. Defaults to .hl_config_get(), an internal function assumed to provide the YAML or config object.

Value

  1. If .dataset_name is specified: a single value (character string) corresponding to that dataset's .field.

  2. If .dataset_name is NULL: a **named character vector** of all datasets' .field values, with names set to each dataset's name.

Details

This function first calls .fh_datasets_list_get to retrieve all datasets in the specified .functional_area. If .dataset_name is provided, it filters down to that single dataset. It then extracts the requested .field (e.g., "directory") from each matched dataset.

Behavior:

  • If no dataset matches .dataset_name, an error is raised.

  • If the .field does not exist in a matched dataset, an error is raised.

  • If multiple datasets match (in the case of .dataset_name = NULL), a named character vector is returned.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Suppose .fh_datasets_list_get("master_data") returns multiple datasets:
  #   name: material, transformation: DSCP_MATE, directory: master_data
  #   name: mat_sales, transformation: DSCP_MATS, directory: master_data
  #   etc...

  # 1) Get 'directory' for ONLY the 'material' dataset
  one_dir <- .fh_dataset_field_get(
    .functional_area = "master_data",
    .dataset_name    = "material",
    .field           = "directory"
  )
  print(one_dir)  # 'master_data'

  # 2) Get 'transformation' for ALL datasets in 'master_data'
  all_trans <- .fh_dataset_field_get(
    .functional_area = "master_data",
    .field           = "transformation"
  )
  print(all_trans)
  # named vector, e.g. c(material = "DSCP_MATE", mat_sales = "DSCP_MATS", ...)
} # }
